ok I am in system, preferences, sound
what should they be set to ?
Sound isnt working on my ubuntu, do I need linux drivers for these ?
you can try going into the AlSA mixer and muting the optical inputs and outputs.  That's worked for me now twice on two different linux's.
try going most of the way to the right and look for anything "optical", then hit M to mute them.
go most of the way to the right and look for anything optical.  Hit M on them to mute them.  It helps if you have a sound playing to see if it works.
it would say optical in the top left of the screen.  The actual slider wouldn't be labeled optical.
it may be that you don't have any optical inputs.  It would say it on the 4th line from the top, where it sez Item:.  You don't see anything that sez optical when you move between the sliders?
Like I said, mine sez "IEC958 Optical".  Make sure it's muted.  It has killed my sound on two different distros.
